column4: what is the easiest way for me to make things so that my monitor refresh is 72hz instead of the default 60hz?
i have researched it, and im still not clear on wut to do
system > preference > monitor i assume you use gnome
i use gnome, but i cant change it from monitor panel
it only gives 60hz as a choice
so my choices are "seeing more stuff" or "72hz"?
i tried 800x600, and i gained 56hz in addition to 60hz, at 640x480, i have only 60hz
i think you should install the driver first follow the link ubootu gave you to see how is the install process
i dont think it is a gfx card drvr issue
i was hoping for something that would allow me to alter the "modeline", not to sure about it all, id rather not have to edit files manually, if i can avoid it
if you not sure its a good this to avoid "mode line"
ya, y i was hoping to find something that might do it for me, along the lines of startup manager "editing" grub file[s] for me
